Keywords: Celebrity , Spider-Man Family , Stark Industries
Real Name: Mary Jane Watson
Special Powers
SECRET IDENTITY: IRON MAN, MARVELLA, SHE-VENOM: When Mary Jane Watson would be KO'd, you may instead replace her with a Secret Identity character with a listed name on click #9. This game, when that replacement is KO'd, it scores this character's points and an additional 25 points.
NEED A DISTRACTION, TIGER?... DON'T FORGET YOU'RE MARRIED TO A MOVIE STAR: POWER: If no friendly bystanders named Paparazzi are on the map, roll a d6. Generate a number of Paparazzi bystanders equal to half the result in unoccupied squares within 4 squares.

December 6, 2020
SkullBrother47
Why are the Spidey citizen folk not coming up in Autonomous Advanced Searches? And why don't they have the icon?
October 5, 2020
brainiacFTW
She is an incredible addition to my Captain America, Principled Incapacitate-themed team, and just incredible in general. She may be my favorite uncommon in a long, long time.
October 3, 2020
mc268
MJ may be my favourite piece in the set. She’s low cost, autonomous, and has decent defences between shape change and ESD. Sidestep helps her position and the Spidey TA is great to see. Her trait is absolutely insane, spanning autonomous incap/tie ups anywhere within four, not bound by line of fire. Even if they don’t hit, they still waste your opponents time, and worst case scenario you use her action to spawn one and use an incap, you’re still getting a tie up and an attack that both don’t count against your action total. The sculpt is great, and when she’s finally knocked out, she brings in great alternate identities. For me, I use Marvella if I want to do some damage, or power up my team, or She-Venom for more incap fun, and a nice probability of keeping her from getting hit. I still love the SFSM version, and she still has her uses on certain teams, but unless I’m playing her, Spinneret for power stealing shenanigans, or Marvella to add Mysterio to a team, this MJ is the one that’ll be on every team now. With her utility for the low cost of 15 points, she will be on basically every Spidey team now.
September 17, 2020
fastcat99
So brutal! Roll the dice, sidestep the paparazzi into the opposition, roll to incap. Next turn, roll to incap, push to death, roll to create more, sidestep and incap...and they're autonomous. Wow, they really made the board a mess. So much fun with her and an autonomous Peter Parker. Holy cow there was so much moving around. Only downside is I thought she was unique and I didn't remember you could spawn the guys up to four squares away. That would have been that much better.
September 16, 2020
Lucian
POWER: If no friendly bystanders named Paparazzi are on the map, roll a d6. Multiple MJs can't pump out more paparazzi unless there are none already on the board.
September 10, 2020
Bobcat2022
This is an MJ of Three Earths: she can turn into Marvella (from the world of the Amazing Spider-Man newspaper comic strip, Earth-77013), She-Venom (Renew Your Vows, Earth-18119) and Iron Man (Earth-616's signing bonus from a story in... 2016? Time flies...). Earth-77013 and Earth-18119's MJs are married to their Peter Parkers, so that's a two-thirds majority for the flavor text, I guess. Earth 616 brings the Stark Industries keyword. I don't think your opponent gets to know which Earth a given MJ is from until she "would be" KO'd, though I could be wrong. Multiverse aside, she really oughta be Unique. One MJ pumping out bystanders makes Mastermind scarier, but two--one to call the press and the other to clear, every turn--makes Mastermind [I]a lot[/I] scarier. All Autonomous, and a very reasonable point cost to boot.
September 5, 2020
bill4935
SCORE: 70%. Mary Jane might be my favourite new tie-up piece. If she starts on Row 1, she can sidestep, generate photographers four squares away, then they sidestep and incap someone on Row 11. If you want to KO her, instead she turns into a Running Shot incapper-immobilizer symbiote with 18DV+SC+SS. And if you try to KO that piece, you score only 40 points for all your hard work. All for the cost of two uncommons.
